Reviews.Title: “Really frendly place”
Reviews.Author: TeddyMoo
Reviews.Content: Its amaizing bed-and-breakfast hotel. Clean rooms, very friendly service and convenient location.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great and clean place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MnYaDvOfMgN
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The management stop at nothing to make sure you are comfortable and happy. Great breakfast every morning and very central to all the top tourist sites (hagia sofia, blue mosque, galata tower, archaeological museum, etc). The bathrooms can be a little small, depending on the room you are staying, but they are functional; lots of hot water. There's free wifi, which we never had any trouble using, even up on the top floor. There's also an elevator which we had no issues with when used. It is a little pricey, 45 Euros a night, but the location and quality of the hotel are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: Suebri_11
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Hatay - it was supposed to be 3 but they mixed up our reservation on our arrival night and sent us to a horrible hotel a couple of doors away. When we went back to the Hatay, the next day, they were sorted out and did give us a room. The room was pretty cramped, and the bedding was a little tired (holes in it), and the internet intermittent. The breakfast was okay but was served across the street at the Antioch hotel. The best thing about the Hatay was the location which was convenient. We came back to Istanbul weeks later, at the end of our stay in Turkey and found much better accommodation, quieter, closer to the attractions for 20 euros less per night. Shop around!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Katrin G
Reviews.Content: The first time I was in Istanbul, my husband - the third. I love the city and the hotel. Staff is very friendly. Room a bit cramped, but for the 6 days of our stay was our own. At the end did not want to leave. Good price. And the breakfasts are good too. Every day I gladly went to the cafe. If you want to relax in comfort, you can safely stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Hatay (and Antioch too)”
Reviews.Author: helloworldhowareyou
Reviews.Content: I really hate to bash a small business, but, these 2 hotels are so poorly run, I can't believe that you can't find better for your money in Istanbul. Really pretty much **everything** was wrong with these hotels. The water, electricity went on and off. My room wasn't clean. The elevator's floors didn't map to the hotel floors. There was no room service at all while I was there. It really was a depressing place. They also wanted to put me on the 6th floor which had no elevator to it and felt like a fire trap. While I was in the lobby, people kept coming downstairs to the front desk with complaint after complaint. Stay away from the Hatay (and Antioch!!!) unless you are looking for something that is funky and more like a youth hostel (nothing against youth hostels but I'm just past the age of roughing it to that extent).

Reviews.Title: “We were deceived and lived in a nearby hotel, beware!”
Reviews.Author: olegkravitz
Reviews.Content: We flew to Istanbul to celebrate the New Year, Hotel Hatay was booked in advance. However, the hotel free rooms did not have and we lived in a nearby hotel Antioch. The Turks know how to deceive and convince us that Antioch is also their property, only the name of another. Number of Antioch was terrible and small. On the last night we all slept in the same alleged hotel room Hatay, where they received the number, which paid for. Breakfast at the hotel of average quality, but will not stay hungry. Tourists beware and ask them to return for their money! ÐŸÑ€Ð¸Ð»ÐµÑ‚ÐµÐ»Ð¸ Ð² Ð¡Ñ‚Ð°Ð¼Ð±ÑƒÐ» Ð¾Ñ‚Ð¼ÐµÑ‡Ð°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ð�Ð¾Ð²Ñ‹Ð¹ Ð³Ð¾Ð´, Ð¾Ñ‚ÐµÐ»ÑŒ Hatay Ð±Ñ‹Ð» Ð·Ð°Ð±Ñ€Ð¾Ð½Ð¸Ñ€Ð¾Ð²Ð°Ð½ Ð·Ð°Ñ€Ð°Ð½ÐµÐµ. Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH THE KINDEST STAFF”
Reviews.Author: waterloosunset123
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the kindest staff ever. They were genuinely kind and helpful.They'll help you get around the city and suggest good and affordable restaurants to eat in. But more than that, they really go out of their way to make you feel at home. When they found out it was my dad's birthday, they actually bought him a cake. This family-run hotel treat their guests like family. The rooms too, although a bit small, are clean and cozy. They also have a generous buffet breakfast served without charge. They also offer a shuttle service for free from the airport but not to the airport. The location is pretty good too. The Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Vyacheslav
Reviews.Content: Hatay hotel is located in a quiet alley just near the main street that runs through Sultanahmet (where the trams are). You can easily reach it by tram, exit at Gulhane and walk down the street for 200 meters. Got the room on 6th floor near the elevator shaft, which translated to loud noise every time somebody was using the elevator. No big deal for me though. Room wasnâ€™t very spacious, however the double bed was perfect â€“ large and comfortable. TV, bathroom, toilet â€“ all in good working condition. Room was clean, but the maid never bothered with everyday cleaning, - just made the bed and changed towels. Breakfast was basic but satisfactory, vegetables, cheese, eggs and sausages, enough to keep you up and running for the morning and there are plenty eating opportunities in Istanbul (Iâ€™d recommend roasted fish sandwiches in one of the cafes under Galata bridge, only 4 TL!). Staff were excellentâ€“ English speaking, most helpful and friendly. All in all â€“ good value for your money (45 EUR / night for a double room / single stay). I can recommend this hotel for Turkish F1 GP (hope it will be there next year!) or anyone visiting Istanbul. Perfect location for all Sultanahmet attractions and trams will get you to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Central location near tourists sites and transport, Clean, helpfull”
Reviews.Author: NVG76
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally located near the major tourists sites (Topaki palace, Gran Bazar,spice market, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, SÃ¼leymaniye Mosque etc) and transport very near also. The hotel and rooms are renovated, clean, and the staff is always smiling and very helpfull, offering a service you would normally see in a 5 star hotel. All in all, if you are visiting Istanbul for tourism, we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of Istanbul's bests”
Reviews.Author: Gred_forge
Reviews.Content: Very well located, with an easy access to public transport. Staff extremely kind and always ready to help. 24 h hot water, rooms very warm. Highly recommending !

Reviews.Title: “Asian Europe”
Reviews.Author: Russian-Orange
Reviews.Content: Well, Hatay hotel is realy about turkish hospitality:) Smiling faces, friendly staff and more. This hotel has a very good location: 10 min walk to Hagia Sofia and Sultanahmet Mosque, 5 min to Galata brige, Eminonu pier and Sirkeci tram staion. Besides it hotel located in side street that makes it quetly. Some words about room. Our room hasn't glasses, table lamb and chairs, with this stuff room will be more comfortable. Most liked thing in this hotel was breakfast. Turkish meals are marvelous! There are all kind of meal you like: cheese, soups, juices, turkish delight and more. Very tasty! So it's good hotel for travelers and i can recomend it for you. So about Istanbul.... It's realy unusual city. Apparently you will never anything like this anywhere in the world. Asian Europe, European Asia no more no less.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained but friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rosiegold
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Antioch hotel months before, but when we arrived were told we could only have an adjacent room for our children if we stayed in the Hatay opposite. The rooms were basic, but seemed adequate for a short stay. However, the door to the children's room wouldn't lock and had to be mended while we were there. The shower cubicle was tiny and leaked very badly and there was mould on the walls of the bathroom. There was also a hole in the glass of the room window. The hot water supply was erratic so usually we had cold showers (fortunately the weather was tropical). However, the location was excellent, in walking distance of the main sites, and near the tram line and mainline station. The staff were generally helpful. The breakfasts were good. The children liked the fact that they had free use of the internet in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumEls
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel because of its location and its very friendly staff. They helped us immediately on arrival with al kinds of information. The rooms were very clean and airconditioned. Price/quality = very good!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jojonosnothin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 and were very disappointed. The only reason we didn't check out and go somewhere else was that everywhere else was booked out! Long story short they over booked the hotel and kept us waiting for 5 hours for our room! When we did eventually get in, the room stunk of cigarette smoke, was dirty, the toilet leaked and the staff were useless. I would never stay here again or recommend it to anyone. It completely ruined our Istanbul experience. The good things about this hotel include the breakfast and the location.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kocakubra
Reviews.Content: i have been there firts with friends and I really liked. so I have been there the second and the third time with my family and they liked to. my friends calling me often or I can book a room in this hotel. the staff is very kind in this hotel. you can trust them, they are helping you with everything. they can reserve a diner in a good restaurant or something else what you have asked them. the most important thing for me is that I can trust the staff in this hotel. I can trust this hotel 100%. the rooms are very clean in this hotel. the cleaner comes every day to clean the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Semosum
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect. We must left the room at 11:00 am, but we can use the rooms until 14:00 pm without extra paying. The personel was very nice and friendly. They help us very good. The rooms are very clean. The personels calling the services for us. We're very saticified about hotel Hatay.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: bhaijaan18
Reviews.Content: it was a good hotel. with great value for money, it was clean it was efficent and the hotel staff were very nice. it was in the best location. with all the main atractions of istanbul within walking distance. and i recommed it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the for the money”
Reviews.Author: YannickRO
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Antioch hotel for two nights in july. What I can say about this hotel is that is very well located in the ceter of the Town, very very nice personal, basic room, maybe a little disconforting was the fact that it was a twin beds room as I have traveld wiith my wife. Very good price , and yes I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: mitchlefleur
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure who is writing the reviews on this site but they are NOT accurate. The rooms are very basic and that's fine. BUT our carpet is ripped. The shower leaks and floods the bathroom every time you shower. There is tons of black mold in the shower and the bathroom smells musty. The bathroom is so small that you can't open the door fully without hitting the toilet. My advice? Go to The Antioch Hotel across the street. It's the same owners but it's much cleaner and the rooms and bathrooms are also a bit bigger. I don't think there is a big price difference, but whatever it is, it's worth it. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Felt safe for solo female”
Reviews.Author: missj11
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights, basic, clean and comfortable, the staff were accomodating and helpful, giving me a good rate and even escorting me on the tram to find the train station to catch a bus ;-)! As a solo female traveller the area felt safe and was a good spot in between sultanahmet and taxsim, all in all good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jennylewandowski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. For the price we paid i couldnt fault it. the rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel was in a perfect location for all the tourist attractions. the tram stop is 2 minutes away but we just walked everywhere. the hotel is down a side street but it is well lit and always busy so we felt safe even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hatay Hotel - very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Aussie999
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hatay Hotel is in the old town so it is convenient to most of the tourist sites. However there are many hotels in this area and you may do better to choose one of those. We stayed at the hotel for four nights in late December 2008. The staff were pleasant enough but were not what I would call friendly, no-one smiled. We were not told that you had to hand in your key to have your room serviced. Not a big deal. On the occassion that our room was serviced we were left with 2 towels and only one hand towel / bath mat and a third of a roll of toilet paper. We were given a room on the first floor. We could clearly hear the noise from the street and the noise from reception. The room was very small and dated (wallpaper stained and peeling and industrial carpet). By a very small room I mean bed pushed up against the wall and 3 feet of space around the bed. The only furnishings in the room were the bed, one side table, a cupboard, a roof mounted tv and a curtain that did not cover the window properly. There was no fridge like other reviews suggest. The bathroom smelt of cigarette smoke (the roof was blackened, not sure what from) and was also tiny. The shower was tiny (3 feet x 2 feet) and had no shower curtain or shower door. I believe the hotel is rated 3 star but it would be pushing to be 2 star anywhere else in Europe. The breakfast was in the hotel across the street and it was a good continental breakfast. I would only suggest staying at this hotel if you were staying for a night or two, were guaranteed a room above the first floor and were not paying a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Both location and hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: moonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days and 5 night in Istanbul.Stuff was very friendly.Location was very nice,1 min from metro station,5 min from Aya Sofia.U would never waste ur time until walking around and would never get tired!!!! TV, fridge,air conditioner -everything in order.Cool breakfast - coffee, or tea, honey, halve,bread, butter, jam,tomatoes,olives, cheese!!!!!! I would like to come back over there again !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & clean”
Reviews.Author: TAAMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. Clean & comfortable rooms. Hotel is situated in the centre of the old city, tram line, Sirkeci train station, and major attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are a short 5 minute walk away. The staff are friendly. Rooms have a fridge & tv. Shower had hot water [something you need to check wherever you stay in Turkey]. Free internet access on the computer in the lobby. The only problem we had was that the electrical wiring was questionable in our room. Only one power outlet was working... and so we had to choose between the following.. tv, fridge or airconditioning. A major pain in the neck. If we had to stay an additional night in Istanbul, we probably would have stayed somewhere else. Turkey in summer is hot, and it would have been nice to sit in our room with airconditioning, watch tv AND have a cool drink from the fridge, all at once!

HotelInfo.Name: Hatay Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nobethane Cad. | Serdar Sokak. No: 5/7 Sirkeci, Istanbul, Turkey
